intro: Perrierodendron occidentale, commonly known as the western perrierodendron, is a rare flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of western Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and leathery, elliptical leaves. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, humid environments. Its unique botanical features make it a subject of interest for botanists studying tropical flora. Due to habitat loss, it is considered vulnerable and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
